result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores. Not contact with the victims.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

To pay the costs of the action on both counts.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts.
Probation agent to request a probation review hearing about 4 months after defendant is done serving his jail sentence. Conditions of probation apply to both counts.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense advises of correction to PSI, gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Correcting violation date on Cts. 1 & 2 to 2/11/2015.
for DNA Sample

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 4. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 4. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Atty Meier asks court to revoke bond in all files. State doesn't feel that is necessary as defendant is being held awaiting sentencing after revocation in 14-CF-72.  Court leaves bonds as previously set in all files.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Discussion regarding representation in new file. Defendant feels he may now qualify for PD. Court won't appoint an atty if defendant qualifies for PD representation. Atty Meier indicates he doesn't take PD appointments, advises he is not currently representing defendant in 15-CF-147 but would like to resolve all matters together along with revocation case.  Atty Meier would like to see discovery on new file, has a few questions of the State before proceeding. Court appoints Atty Meier in 15-CF-147 only, sets plea hearing for 12/30/15. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Meier requests a status in December. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gabriel L Perez
Current: 6159 Highway 42, Egg Harbor, WI 54209 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2015)
Prior: 1618 Texas St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives reading of Information and stands mute regarding the charges. Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf to all charges. Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez appears by video conference along with attorney Rick Brian Meier who appears by phone.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Meier indicates he's appearing by phone as he is ill, asks court to reschedule matter. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Meier requests an arraignment date in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty Meier asking court to set a preliminary hearing. Court grants request.
Preliminary hearing at 07-21-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Meier advises he will now be representing defendant instead of Atty Schaefer. Clerk will make that change in the court record.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Meier requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
from defendant requesting more time to retain own atty. Court moves AIA to 4/13/15 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-13-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant indicates he's in the process of retaining his own attorney, requests a little more time to do so. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No contact direct or indirect with building at 216 S. 18th Avenue. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers, who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
